title: Burkey Belser, designer of ubiquitous nutrition facts label, dies at 76
description: His creation is celebrated as a triumph of public health and a masterpiece of graphic design. Millions of people use it every day.

title: Tracking the path of Tropical Storm Philippe
description: We’re tracking the path of Tropical Storm Philippe, which has formed in the Atlantic

title: Video of Sikh leader’s killing shows coordinated attack
description: Witnesses and security camera footage viewed by The Post reveal a more complex operation to kill Hardeep Singh Nijjar than authorities have previously described.

title: Giorgio Napolitano, elder statesman of Italian politics, dies at 98
description: The long-serving president of Italy was a pillar of stability in the hurly-burly of his country’s politics.

title: Ethnic Armenians flee Nagorno-Karabakh as Russia fails to uphold peace deal
description: Officials are bracing for a humanitarian crisis as Azerbaijan moves to retake control of the mountainous regions and thousands of ethnic Armenian residents leave their homes, fearing ethnic cleansing.

title: The Chilean president’s D.C. visit took me back to Pinochet’s rule
description: Gabriel Boric attended ceremonies for Salvador Allende, killed in the 1973 CIA-backed coup, and an exiled diplomat killed in Washington three years later.

title: Tucker Carlson takes a dubbing in debut Russia ‘show’
description: The former Fox News host’s anti-Ukrainian, anti-Biden rhetoric aligns so well with Kremlin propaganda that a Russian channel, Rossiya 24, is airing dubbed excerpts of his internet show.

title: France to withdraw diplomats, troops from Niger following coup
description: The French president said his country’s troops would withdraw from Niger in the coming weeks and months, with a full pullout set by the end of the year.

title: What to know about M1 Abrams tanks and why they matter to Ukraine
description: One of the United States’ most advanced battle tanks has arrived in Ukraine, where the M1 Abrams is expected to be used in the ongoing counteroffensive.

title: Jailed mafia boss dies after 30 years on the run
description: Italy’s most infamous mafia boss — Matteo Messina Denaro, 61 — died after a battle with colon cancer.

title: Matteo Messina Denaro, ruthless mob boss and longtime fugitive, dies at 61
description: Among his murder convictions was one for the slaying of the son of a turncoat. The boy was abducted and strangled, and his body was dissolved in a vat of acid.

title: Russia attacks Odessa port, in latest assault on Ukrainian grain
description: Moscow has stepped up attacks on Ukraine’s vital agriculture sector, possibly to exploit divisions between Kyiv and its European neighbors over grain exports.

title: Voicing his fury at Ukraine, Putin draws accusations of antisemitism
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has repeatedly questioned Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s Jewish heritage, calling him a “disgrace to the Jewish people”

title: Ukraine’s grain at center stage in battle for votes in Poland’s election
description: Polish farmers angry over cheap Ukrainian grain imports are posing a real challenge to Poland’s ruling Law and Justice Party ahead of elections on Oct. 15.

title: Who blew up the Nord Stream pipelines? What we know one year later.
description: Official investigations in three countries have yielded few answers in the year since underwater explosions damaged the gas pipelines linking Russia and Europe.

title: Some U.K. police refuse their guns after officer charged in shooting death
description: British prosecutors authorized a murder charge against the unnamed Metropolitan Police officer, who is accused of killing Chris Kaba in South London last year.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Odessa port damaged in attack from Black Sea, officials say
description: A Canadian lawmaker apologized for praising Yaroslav Hunka, a Ukrainian World War II veteran of a Nazi unit, during President Volodymr Zelensky’s visit.

title: Why thousands of people missing in the Mediterranean are never identified
description: The first quarter of 2023 was the deadliest in the central Mediterranean since 2017. Experts say more should be done to identify the dead and offer closure to families.

title: ‘This is not just Putin’s war’: How Finland’s top diplomat sees Ukraine
description: New NATO member Finland is trying to lead by example by investing heavily into its defense industry, Finnish Foreign Minister Elina Valtonen said in a wide-ranging interview about the trajectory of the war in Ukraine.
